title: Advanced English Proficiency Quiz - Hard Mode
description: This quiz challenges your understanding of advanced English grammar, vocabulary, and idiomatic expressions.
instructions: Read each question or prompt carefully.
Provide the most appropriate and advanced response or correction.
Submit your answers after completing all the questions.

items.question: Complete the sentence with the correct form of the verb: 'If I ___ (to know) about the traffic, I would have left earlier.'
Identify and correct the error in the sentence: 'One of the students have lost their textbook.'
items.suggestedAnswer: Correction: 'One of the students has lost his or her textbook.'

items.question: What does the idiom 'to bite off more than you can chew' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: To take on a task that is too big or beyond one's ability.

items.question: Rewrite the sentence in the passive voice: 'The committee will announce the results tomorrow.'
items.suggestedAnswer: The results will be announced by the committee tomorrow.

items.question: Correct the sentence: 'Neither the teachers nor the principal are in the office today.'
items.suggestedAnswer: Correction: 'Neither the teachers nor the principal is in the office today.'

items.question: Explain the difference in usage between 'affect' and 'effect'.
items.suggestedAnswer: 'Affect' is usually a verb meaning 'to influence,' while 'effect' is a noun meaning 'a result or outcome.'

items.question: Complete the sentence: 'Despite his many achievements, he remains ___.' (use an appropriate adjective)
Identify the error: 'She is one of those who loves or love to travel.'
items.suggestedAnswer: Correction: 'She is one of those who love to travel.'

items.question: What does the phrase 'turning a blind eye' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: To ignore something and pretend not to see it.

scoring.4-6 correct answers: Good effort! You're learning well, keep practicing to improve further.
